en.title: Ansible – Lesson 7: Ad-Hoc Commands
en.subtitle: Running one-line automation tasks using Ansible ad-hoc commands

sections.heading: 1. What are Ad-Hoc Commands?
sections.content: Ad-hoc commands are one-line Ansible commands used to perform quick tasks without writing a full playbook.

sections.heading: 2. When to Use Ad-Hoc Commands?
sections.content: Use ad-hoc commands for quick checks, reboots, file copy, package installation and service status.

sections.heading: 3. Basic Command Structure
sections.content: ansible <host-pattern> -m <module> -a <arguments>

sections.heading: 4. Ping Test Using Ad-Hoc Command
sections.content: Use: ansible all -m ping to check connectivity of all servers.

sections.heading: 5. Running Shell Commands
sections.content: Use shell module to run Linux commands: ansible all -m shell -a "uptime"

sections.heading: 6. Installing Package Using Ad-Hoc
sections.content: Use package module to install a package: ansible all -m apt -a "name=nginx state=present"

sections.heading: 7. Copying Files Using Ad-Hoc
sections.content: Use copy module: ansible all -m copy -a "src=test.txt dest=/tmp/test.txt"

sections.heading: 8. Managing Services
sections.content: Use service module to start/stop services: ansible all -m service -a "name=nginx state=started"

sections.heading: 9. Rebooting Servers
sections.content: Use reboot module: ansible all -m reboot

sections.heading: 10. Checking Disk Space
sections.content: Use shell module: ansible all -m shell -a "df -h"

sections.heading: 11. Advantages of Ad-Hoc Commands
sections.content: Fast execution, no playbook required, ideal for troubleshooting and quick automation.

sections.heading: Lesson 7 Summary
sections.content: You learned what ad-hoc commands are, when to use them, and how to perform common tasks using them.

ta.title: Ansible – பாடம் 7: Ad-Hoc Commands
ta.subtitle: Playbook எழுதாமல் ஒரே command மூலம் automation செய்வது

sections.heading: 1. Ad-Hoc Command என்றால் என்ன?
sections.content: ஒரே command-ல் quick task செய்ய பயன்படுத்தப்படும் Ansible command தான் Ad-hoc command.

sections.heading: 2. எப்போது Ad-Hoc பயன்படுத்தலாம்?
sections.content: Quick test, reboot, file copy, software install போன்ற வேலையிற்கு பயன்படுத்தலாம்.

sections.heading: 3. Basic Command Structure
sections.content: ansible <hosts> -m <module> -a <arguments>

sections.heading: 4. Ping Test
sections.content: ansible all -m ping command மூலம் server connectivity test செய்யலாம்.

sections.heading: 5. Linux Command Run செய்வது
sections.content: shell module மூலம் uptime போன்ற command run செய்யலாம்.

sections.heading: 6. Software Install
sections.content: apt module மூலம் nginx install செய்யலாம்.

sections.heading: 7. File Copy
sections.content: copy module மூலம் files server-ல் copy செய்யலாம்.

sections.heading: 8. Service Control
sections.content: service module மூலம் services start/stop செய்யலாம்.

sections.heading: 9. Server Reboot
sections.content: reboot module மூலம் server restart செய்யலாம்.

sections.heading: 10. Disk Space Check
sections.content: df -h command மூலம் disk space check செய்யலாம்.

sections.heading: 11. Ad-Hoc Command Advantages
sections.content: Fast execution, playbook தேவையில்லை, troubleshooting-க்கு best.

sections.heading: Lesson 7 Summary
sections.content: Ad-hoc commands எப்படி பயன்படுத்துவது என்பதை நீங்கள் கற்றுக்கொண்டீர்கள்.
